instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics error/ kernel panic
threads.message:
got in a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with graphics errors, just wondering if this model also needs the part changed out like the rest of the 2009 models and if so what is the part number? 
Thanks 
Nate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics error/ kernel panic
threads.message: These do not even have a GPU. If it kernel panics it is more likely bad RAM or bad slot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics error/ kernel panic
threads.message:
lol good 2 know.. that is what the customer said i didn't even test it until now. appears to be liquid damaged. powers on to a chime but has no video, the backlight turns on partially not a bright screen but faint. no data. found the <CHIP>U7840</CHIP> pin 6 <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> was burned off the tab. i replaced it and its still the same thing i'm checking pin 3 on the <CHIP>U7840</CHIP> and im getting 3.34v it says its <SIGNAL>P1V05_S5_PGOOD</SIGNAL> should this be 1.5v or is 3.34v correct there?
also <CAPACITOR>C7840</CAPACITOR> looks like rainbow colors on the 3v42 side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics error/ kernel panic
threads.message: Check all LVDS lines on diode mode at the LCD connector. Check with a known good LCD/cable.
